intro: Pachira mawarinumae, commonly known as the Mawarina pachira, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
